name: Military Police Area
detail: Historic entrance area and guard station.
subDetail: Immerse yourself in a visit to Minidoka War Relocation Center at the historic camp entrance under the shadow of a guard tower.

photos.caption: Ruins of Military Police entrance station. 2015.
Ruins of Military Police visitor reception area. 2015.
Camp entrance area. Entrance station at left, reception area at right.
photos.credit: Courtesy of NPS, Koyama Collection

photos.caption: Unidentified member of Military Police poses by entrance station.
photos.credit: Courtesy of NPS, Koyama Collection

photos.caption: Camp entrance area with buses.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

name: Guard Tower
subDetail: Stop at the historic camp entrance to see a reconstructed guard tower and get a sense of confinement that incarcerees were faced with.

photos.caption: Reconstructed entrance guard tower. 2015.
Entrance to Minidoka. 1944.
photos.credit: Contributed by Densho, courtesy of the Mitsuoka Family Collection.

name: North Side Canal
subDetail: Learn about the role of water at Minidoka and its unlikely source.

photos.caption: Hunt Bridge and the North Side Canal. 2015.
Original WRA caption: A view of the Twin Falls North Side Canal which borders this War Relocation Authority center on the south. 1942.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: Original WRA caption: Establishing irrigation controls, land reclamation. June 1944.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

name: Hospital
subDetail: Learn about historic hospital operations at Minidoka in an area that now serves as farmland.

photos.caption: Minidoka War Relocation Center hospital nursery. December 1942.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: Minidoka War Relocation Center dentist, Doctor T. Nakamura. December 1942.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: Minidoka Irrigator article praises hospital operations, September 1943.
photos.credit: Contributed by Densho, Courtesy of Cherry Kinoshita

photos.caption: Nikkei hospital staff. High school students often worked part time as nurses' aides. June 1943.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: Patients at Minidoka War Relocation Center hospital. November 1942.
photos.credit: Courtesy of Oregon Nikkei Endowment, ONLC 112

name: Honor Roll
subDetail: Gain an understanding of the various displays of patriotism and experience the irony of military service during incarceration when you visit this reconstructed Honor Roll.

photos.caption: Reconstructed honor roll. 2015.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: Historic photograph of the original honor roll.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: Kaun, Ko, and Satoru Onodera, brothers incarcerated at Minidoka, volunteer for the Army while the entire family looks on.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: These four brothers, Kenny, Chester, Ted, and Howard Sakura, all volunteered for service in the 442nd regimental combat team of the United States Army while incarcerated at Minidoka.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: Buddhist funeral for a fallen soldier in a Minidoka recreation hall.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

name: Administrative Area
subDetail: Visit the site of the administration area and learn about life as a WRA employee at Minidoka.

photos.caption: Administrative area. 1943.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: WRA staff housing.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: Tura Nakamura, block manager of block 42-44 presents ceremonial Tai fish to Project Director, H.L. Stafford and Philip Schafer, assistant project director. 1943.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: H.L. Stafford, project director of Minidoka War Relocation Center. 1943.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

name: Fire Station
subDetail: Visit this historic fire station and learn about life as an incarceree firefighter.

photos.caption: Fire Station No. 1. 2015.
Fire Station No. 1. 2015.
Fire crew in front of Fire Station No. 1. 1944.
photos.credit: Contributed by Densho, courtesy of the Mamiya Family Collection

photos.caption: Original WRA caption: The fire crew of station #1 swings into action. 1943.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: Unknown women in front of Fire Station No. 2. November 1942.
photos.credit: Courtesy of Oregon Nikkei Endowment, ONLC 93

name: Herrmann House
subDetail: Stop by this 1950s era home to learn about post-war land use and development of the former incarceration site.

photos.caption: Herrmann house. 2015.
portion of historic barracks; Herrmann family milking barn. 2015.
Program from Farm-in-a-Day event.
photos.credit: Minidoka NHS Museum Collection

photos.caption: John and Elfreida Herrmann. April 17, 1952.
photos.credit: Jerome County Historical Society Collections.

photos.caption: Local organizations provided refreshments. April 17, 1952.
photos.credit: Jerome County Historical Society Collections.

photos.caption: Fire Station no. 1 during Farm-in-a-Day. April 17, 1952.

name: Water Tower #2
subDetail: The large foundations of this water tower were recently uncovered for visitors to see. Learn about water usage at Minidoka.

photos.caption: concrete footings of Water Tower #2. 2015.
Historic photograph of one of the camp water towers. August 1942.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: Original WRA caption: Brush fire midsection of camp. 1945.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

name: Sewage Plant
subDetail: Learn about some of the necessary infrastructure for a desert area to support a population boom.

photos.caption: Site of former sewage treatment center. 2015.
Orignal WRA caption: Hunt, Idaho. Minidoka sewage treatment plant.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: Minidoka student essay excerpt: "As the silhouette of summer slowly desends (sp) upon Minidoka, the fragrant smell of garlic blooms and the sewage plant drifts about with the playful breezes." 1943.
photos.credit: Contributed by Densho, Courtesy of Helen Amerman Manning Collection

name: Gas Station
subDetail: Minidoka functioned like a small city. See the concrete remains of Minidoka's gas station here.

photos.caption: Remains of historic gas station. 2015.

name: Tire / Motor Repair Shop and Warehouse Area
detail: Historic warehouse area and tire shop.
subDetail: Visit the largest remaining historic structure at Minidoka and learn more about camp operations.

text.name: Tire / Motor Repair Shop and Warehouse Area

photos.caption: Half of a historic warehouse that held a tire repair shop. 2015.
Motor pool area. Notice the warehouses in the background.

photos.caption: Incarcerees repairing a car in a warehouse.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: Minidoka motor pool area.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

name: Outdoor Amphitheater
subDetail: Participation in sports and community gatherings was a memorable and positive aspect of the Minidoka experience for incarcerees.

photos.caption: Site of former amphitheater and newly reconstructed baseball field. 2016.
photos.credit: Courtesy of Ryan Kozu.

photos.caption: Richard Sakurai and Shingo Inouye in front of scoreboard at Minidoka.
photos.credit: Courtesy of National Park Service, Sakurai Collection.

photos.caption: Group funeral for fallen soldiers, held in amphitheater.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration.

photos.caption: Area A basketball champs.1944.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration.

photos.caption: Winners of a cross country run pictured with WRA P.E. instructors.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration.

name: Block 22 Overlook
subDetail: Visit Block 22 to explore a typical residential block layout complete with historic structures. Block 22 served as a community services center at Minidoka and held offices and the cooperative store.

photos.caption: Overlooking Block 22. 2015.
First Communion class of Catholic Church at Minidoka.1943.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration.

photos.caption: Inside the Minidoka Consumers Cooperative store.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration.

photos.caption: Workers in the Minidoka Irrigator newspaper office. 1943.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration.

photos.caption: Block 22 office map. Six of the barracks remained residential.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration.

name: Barracks as Classrooms
detail: Junior high and high school block.
subDetail: Minidoka's youth traveled to Block 23 to attend junior high and high school. The layout was the same as residential blocks, and barracks buildings served as classrooms.

photos.caption: Hunt High School students outside of a barracks classroom.
photos.credit: Contributed by Densho, Courtesy of the Bigelow Family Collection

photos.caption: Dedication of the Stafford Elementary School flag pole. 1943.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: Girls study in Hunt High School classroom. Mural painted by students.1944.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration.

photos.caption: Adult education class in carpentry. 1943.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration.

photos.caption: Students in barracks classroom. November 1942.
photos.credit: Courtesy of Oregon Nikkei Endowment, ONLC 76

name: Root Cellar
subDetail: Learn about the agricultural legacy of incarcerated Nikkei as you peer into this 1940s era root cellar.

photos.caption: Entrance of historic root cellar. 2015.
Incarcerees harvesting corn at Minidoka. 1943.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: Stafford Elementary School students clearing sagebrush to plant vegetable crops. 1943.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

photos.caption: Japanese Americans harvesting potatoes at Minidoka.
photos.credit: Contributed by Densho, Courtesy of the Bigelow Family Collection

photos.caption: Minidoka's hog and poultry farm.
photos.credit: Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration

name: Behind Barbed Wire
subDetail: The barbed wire fence was a humiliating physical reminder of confinement for 13,078 Nikkei who lived at Minidoka during the war.

photos.caption: Historic reconstruction of barbed wire perimeter fence. 2015.
The fence along the North Side Canal remained until camp closure.
Barbed wire fence and guard tower. November 1942.
photos.credit: Courtesy of Oregon Nikkei Endowment, ONLC 104
